subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Negative Experience
author: lisby@earthlink.net
full_text:
Fair enough. I understand experiences that defy all attempts at Earth logic, as it were. I've had them, too.

As I said, just food for thought.

Ann

-----Original Message-----
>From: babiarz3 <babiarz3@...>
>Sent: Dec 4, 2007 10:31 AM
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Negative Experience
>
>Ann,
>
>Without knowing me, I can understand your offering of other possible
>causes of my experience. As investigators, that is our obligation; to
>look for all possible causes of supposed paranormal phenomenon. I am
>sure that I would have the same reaction as you after having read
>about the experience. I have found that the investigators I respect
>the most are those with the ability to be skeptical. I train my new
>members to be objective.
>
>Now, all that being said... I won't attempt to try to persuade you to
>believe that my story is exactly what happened. I can't and don't feel
>a need to. I know that any story related by anyone can fall into the
>symptoms you state below, including your own. I can only offer you the
>following to consider;
>
>I am a 40 year old educated and intelligent female. I am not now, nor
>have I ever been in treatment for or taken medication for mental
>illness. I have never experienced a panic attack. I do not use drugs.
>I am not given to flights of fancy and am described as analytical and
>pragmatic. I have been fully involved in the field for 6 years. That
>night was the first and only time I ever experienced what I did. I do
>not scare. I run towards noises, shadows etc. I am a trusted sensitive
>with enough validation to discredit even my own hard core skepticism.I
>am objective. 
>
>Now that the majority of a witness interview is complete LOL, I am
>done with the post.  
>
>
>
>--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, lisby@... wrote:
>>
>> Thank you for sharing that so honestly with me. I really appreciate
>it. :)
>> 
>> Let me give you my comments, none of which are meant to belittle
>your experience, rather to provide food for thought: I am sure that
>the feelings you experienced ("I began to feel what I can only
>describe as "thick" energy move into my hand, up my arm, through my
>chest and then settle into my stomach...It began to churn and move up
>into my throat..I felt paralyzed. ...It took approximately 30 minutes
>before I felt myself again,") were very real to you. You said you
>thought it was evil; that your vomit would be black (an image straight
>out of classic demonolgy). Indeed, you said that everyone in the room
>had the similar mindset: Whatever you there to confront was
>dark/negative/evil.
>> 
>> Speaking from my own personal experience, I have seen groups of
>people involved in the paranormal convince themselves of similar (and
>many far, far weirder) things. Hell, as a teen, I was involved in
>several of these folies-a-deux (or 10, 15, 20, or more). I saw people
>having experiences similar to what you report. At one point, friends
>of mine were receiving alledged telepathic communication from a living
>rock star who was helping them commune with spirit of Alisdar Crowley,
>for example. Others in the group or on its periphery were getting
>"attacked" by what we called AWOLs (from "Away Without Leave"). Hell,
>I thought I'd been attacked by a few myself. But now, many years
>later, what I see this particular group, and others, was comprised of
>was a lot of people damned busy scaring the shit out of themselves.
>Maybe real dark forces *were* feeding off the bad vibes--I dunno. But
>what I witnessed is rendolent of the Salem hysteria in the late 1600s,
>the "Amityville Horror" case, and many, many others, in descending
>order of sensationalism, down to the ubiquitous freakouts of kids
>playing with the Ouija board.
>> 
>> Fear and anxiety produce painful and uncomfortabl physical effects
>in the body that could be interpreted as caused by a negative outside
>influence. Fear causes the body to become flooded with hormones
>(particularly adrenalin). Here is a list of symptoms (from Wikipedia)
>of what we commonly call a panic attack:
>> 
>> Physical
>> 
>>     * An extremely unpleasant sensation of adrenaline over the
>entire body
>>     * Sweating
>>     * Shortness of breath
>>     * Racing or pounding heartbeat or palpitations
>>     * Chest pain
>>     * Dizziness or vertigo
>>     * Lightheadedness
>>     * Nausea / stomach pains
>>     * Hyperventilation
>>     * Choking or smothering sensations
>>     * Uncontrollable itching
>>     * Tingling or numbness in the hands, face, feet or mouth
>(paresthesia)
>>     * Hot/cold flashes
>>     * Trembling or shaking
>>     * Feeling of claustrophobia
>>     * Exhaustion
>>     * Feeling of physical weakness or limpness of the body
>>     * Uncontrollable crying
>> 
>> Mental
>>     * Loss of the ability to react logically to stimuli
>>     * Loss of cognitive ability in general
>>     * Racing thoughts (often based on fear; a repeated or illogical
>worry)
>>     * Loud internal dialogue
>>     * Feeling of impending doom
>>     * Feeling of "going crazy"
>>     * Extreme worried feeling
>>     * Feeling of extreme nervousness
>>     * Feeling out of control
>>     * Feeling of Threatening
>>     * Feeling of anti-social behaviour from other people
>>     * Feeling of excitement
>>     * Feeling of nagging from other people
>>     * Vision is somewhat impaired (eyes may feel like they are shaking.)
>> 
>> Emotional
>> 
>>     * Terror, or a sense that something unimaginably horrible is
>about to occur and one is powerless to prevent it
>>     * Fear that the panic is a symptom of a serious illness
>>     * Fear of losing control
>>     * Fear of death
>>     * Fear of going crazy
>>     * Flashbacks to earlier panic trigger
>> 
>>  Perceptual
>> 
>>     * Tunnel vision
>>     * Heightened senses
>>     * The apparent slowing down or speeding up of time
>>     * Dream-like sensation or perceptual distortion (derealization)
>>     * Dissociation, or the perception that one is not connected to
>the body or is disconnected from space and time (depersonalization)
>>     * Feeling of loss of free will, as if acting entirely
>automatically without control
>> 
>> I have to submit that the symptoms you describe for yourself and
>others involved that night are found on this list. In fact, a lot of
>descriptions of "attacks by dark forces" sound like the physiological
>effects of fear and anxiety. Am I saying you had a panic attack? No.
>But I am suggesting it is a possibility to consider. Because you were
>in a situation where you believed that "evil" would be present, thus
>generating fear, Occam's Razor would certainly lead us to conclude
>that adrenaline that made you feel the way you did. But Occam's Razor
>proves it's general trustworthines by periodic exceptions.
>> 
>> HMO and not an attack or judgement on your (or anyone's) beliefs,
>> 
>> Ann
>> 
>> 
>> 
>> -----Original Message-----
>> >From: babiarz3 <babiarz3@...>
>> >Sent: Dec 4, 2007 8:28 AM
>> >To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>> >Subject: [EVP-ITC] Negative Experience
>> >
>> >Ann,
>> >
>> >I tried to relocate the post in which you asked me about my negative
>> >experiences. After 10 minutes searching... new topic.
>> >
>> >As it relates to the box, I really only have two personal experiences
>> >that might be considered negative. 
>> >
>> >The first one is contained in a posting I just made prior to this. I
>> >will refer you back to it, if you don't mind. The experience is
>> >contained in the copy and paste from my April 17, 2007 blog. It did
>> >not effect me personally  but I did witness the effects of negative
>> >energy on what/who came through the box. 
>> >
>> >The second negative experience is one I have not spoken of to anyone
>> >besides who was there that day and one close trusted friend. This
>> >occurred in September of this year:
>> >Chris, myself and four others who will remain nameless, were gathered
>> >in a hotel room. For the sake of the story, I will refer to the main
>> >subject as Mary. 
>> >Mary had been experiencing severe negative phenomenon for years. This
>> >included poltergeist type activity, personal harm and had since moved
>> >into effecting her young son. I can not get into the exact details of
>> >this negativity but suffice it to say that all accounts led everyone
>> >to believe that Mary was dealing with a demon or demons. 
>> >This was the second time Mary had sought out Chris for assistance. 
>> >The first time she had noticed a change for a short time but then
>> >"things" had returned as before and in some instances had worsened.
>> >This particular day Mary found herself surrounded by trusted friends
>> >and was ready to try again. There was a psychic medium, a healer and,
>> >myself, a sensitive along with another person with no stated
>> >abilities. Our goal was to turn on the box and receive some direction
>> >about what to do and how to help. I won't reveal the details of what
>> >was said as they are not relevant to the post topic. 
>> >As some time went on and we moved into a second session with the box,
>> >Chris became noticeably weaker. It was obvious that his energy was
>> >being used. I noticed that I was becoming quite weepy. You'll have to
>> >take my word on this when I say I am not a weepy person. Sensitive or
>> >not, I do not become emotional. Yet as time passed, I found I couldn't
>> >control the tears falling. I rationalized it by recognizing I was
>> >probably becoming emotional with compassion as Mary discussed very
>> >private issues. 
>> >The psychic medium present told us at this point that we should place
>> >our hands on Mary. Not considering that I was in no state to offer
>> >energy/help to anyone, I placed my hand on Mary's leg. Suddenly, I
>> >began to feel what I can only describe as "thick" energy move into my
>> >hand, up my arm, through my chest and then settle into my stomach. As
>> >it sat in my stomach I could literally feel it turn into sludge. It
>> >began to churn and move up into my throat. At this point, I knew I was
>> >going to vomit and I knew it would be black. I knew this was evil.
>> >Fortunately, some focus switched to me at this point because I felt
>> >paralyzed. I was removed from the room and brought outside where, with
>> >assistance, I was able to let go of what was not mine. It took
>> >approximately 30 minutes before I felt myself again.
>> >Back to Mary for a moment; After the sessions that night, she had a
>> >noticeable physical change, in particular to her face. It shocked me.
>> >Where she had appeared hard or almost calloused in her expressions,
>> >she was now much softer in appearance. Her life improved dramatically.
>> >She has had one more session with Chris and the box and things
>> >continue to improve.
>> >The TTTD or Frank's Box or whatever you want to refer to it as, is a
>> >powerful device. It has the ability to connect to other dimensions. It
>> >can be a wonderful thing. It can also be quite scary in the wrong
>> >hands. I believe that just as good can be called upon to help, so can
>> >dark and we know that there are many people out there who are far more
>> >concerned in working with lower levels than the higher.  
>> >
>>
>
>
